root.message: The ADJUSTMENT field for indicator 6-6-1b, translated into en
root.data:
As indicated in item 2.c the international standard classification being used is the Ramsar Classification System for Wetland Types, adopted at the Fourth Meeting of the Conference of the Parties to the Convention on Wetlands (COP4) in 1990.

Even that the Convention has a regional approach with six Ramsar regions the harmonization of breakdowns on SDG classifications for regional grouping for compliance with SDG processes.
